intro: Pradosia restingae, commonly known as the Restinga pradosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often found in restinga ecosystems. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy conditions, making it an important component of coastal vegetation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
